intro: Hieracium polychnoum, commonly known as the many-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant spreads through both seeds and rhizomes. Hieracium polychnoum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
